title: Ticket #1228: CLASSAD_LIB_PATH for new ClassAds
description: So called Old ClassAds allow for loading new functions via shared libraries dropped into CLASSAD_LIB_PATH. New ClassAds appear to contain the same low-level functionality, see classad/fnCall.cpp and classad/extra_tests.cpp, but it is not exposed by Condor. It should be exposed, possibly via CLASSAD_LIB_PATH.
remarks:
2010-Feb-18 16:45:24 by jfrey:
Old ClassAds can be given a single shared library that provides additional ClassAd functions (via CLASSAD_LIB_PATH). If the evaluation code encounters a function that's not implemented in the ClassAd library and CLASSAD_LIB_PATH is set, it tries to open the library and look for a function with the same name as the ClassAd function being evaluated. If it finds one, it invokes it.

In new ClassAds, you can supply multiple shared libraries that provide additional ClassAd functions. You explicitly register each library, at which point ClassAds opens the library and attempts to invoke a function named 'Init'. Init is expected to return an array of structs that provides a function name and function pointer for each new ClassAd function.

The signature of the functions in the shared library is different between new and old ClassAds. In new ClassAds, all new functions must be registered before they can be invoked. In order to transparently support the old ClassAd shared libraries, we'd have to modify the new ClassAds code to be willing to deal with just-in-time lookups of added functions or figure out how to scan a shared library for all additional functions.

2010-Feb-19 11:16:51 by matt:
Allowing for CLASSAD_LIB_PATH with new ClassAds is probably sufficient. Making the DSO mechanism backward compatible is likely overkill.

2010-May-07 15:24:46 by jfrey:
Given the difference between the ABIs of new and old ClassAds for user-defined functions, we will add a new config parameter for specifying libraries for new ClassAd functions. The old paramater (CLASSAD_LIB_PATH) will no longer work. Condor may send email to the administrator if the parameter is defined in the config file.

2010-May-11 15:42:48 by jfrey:
Pushed a commit to master for 7.5.3.

There's now a CLASSAD_USER_LIBS config param, a list of libraries containing user-defined new ClassAd functions.
